quantityRules.description: Single axolotl requires 20 gallons minimum (24Ã—12Ã—12 inches filled to 10 inches water depth). Each additional axolotl requires 10 more gallons.

careTargets.gradient: Aquatic - cold water temperature control required

lifespan: 10-15 years in captivity, up to 20 years with excellent care
setupTips: Requires aquarium chiller or cool room to maintain 60-68Â°F water temperature
Use fine sand or bare bottom substrate - avoid gravel (impaction risk)
Provide hides and low-flow filtration - strong currents stress axolotls
notes: Neotenic salamander - retains juvenile features throughout life
Regenerates lost limbs, tail, and even parts of organs
Very sensitive to water quality - requires cycled tank
Aquatic species - requires specialized aquarium setup

warnings.message: Temperature above 72Â°F can be fatal. Requires aquarium chiller or naturally cool room (basement, AC). This is NOT optional.
Must establish nitrogen cycle before adding axolotl. Ammonia and nitrite are toxic. Test water parameters weekly.
No gravel substrate - axolotls gulp food and can swallow gravel causing fatal impaction. Use fine sand or bare bottom only.

feedingRequirements: Feed with tongs or drop food in front of axolotl
waterNotes: Use dechlorinated tap water or spring water
Test parameters: Ammonia 0ppm, Nitrite 0ppm, Nitrate <20ppm, pH 6.5-8.0
Must cycle tank for 4-6 weeks before adding axolotl
mistingNotes: Maintain water level and temperature instead
Use aquarium chiller or cooling fan if needed
